DOC.detailed_description: Our study investigate metabolic response play competitive non-violent competitive violent video game . Our primary hypothesis metabolic response violent game group differ two group , due activation stress response . We use experimental approach , whereby 72 young men randomise one three group : watch TV , play non-violent video game 'FIFA2013 ' , play violent video game 'Call Duty ' . All participant must already experience play two game , whichever group assign , comply protocol . Participants arrive overnight fast , give standardise breakfast ( muffin , approx 300 kcal , glass water ) . After measurement weight , height waist girth , assign one three group , allow familiarise game console TV . Baseline data blood pressure ( triplicate , Accutor digital monitor ) , heart rate ( Polar monitor ) appetite/mood ( visual analogue scale ) collect , along saliva sample measurement 'stress ' hormone , cortisol , well satiety hormone sich leptin ghrelin . We collect data 4 time-points one hour game-playing session , pause game TV 4 minute 15 , 30 , 45 60 minute session start . At end study , allow participant half hour rest , choose variety sweet savoury snack fruit , several drink . We compare data three group , test whether change blood pressure , heart rate , appetite/mood salivary hormone , well snack consumption , great group play violent game .
